metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5069 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) filesystem::get_wml_location function in filesystem.cpp and (2) is_legal_file function in filesystem_boost.cpp in Battle for Wesnoth before 1.12.3 and 1.13.x before 1.13.1 allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via vectors related to inclusion of .pbl files from WML.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5069` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wesnoth - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12 - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-aoi - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-core - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-data - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-did - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-dm - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-dw - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-ei - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-httt - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-l - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-low - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-music - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-nr - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-server - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-sof - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-sotbe - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-thot - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-tools - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-trow - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-tsg - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-ttb - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-1.12-utbs - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-core - 1:1.12.4-1
wesnoth-music - 1:1.12.4-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> incomplete fix lead to CVE-2015-5070

criterions.comment: wesnoth-1.12 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.12.4-1').
